application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Sunnyvale, CA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA; Seattle, WA, USA
description:
At Google, we put our users first. From innovative software products like Gmail, YouTube, Chrome, Street View to pioneering mobile devices like the Android, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. The Product Management team works closely with our engineers to guide products from conception to launch. As part of the Product Management team, you bridge the technical and business worlds as you design services that our customers love. You'll work with Googlers from Engineering, Sales, Marketing, and Finance, to name just a few. You have a bias toward action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed. As a Product Manager, you will be part of shaping Google's next moonshot.

As the Product Manager for Gaming Cloud Solutions, you'll be responsible for defining, designing and influencing the products that we build for our Gaming solutions that leverage technologies already built in Google Cloud. You will work closely with our customers, system vendors and other functions supporting Gaming within Google to help define the key set of product requirements and products that will help us get further engage across all facets of the industry. You will also work closely with Product Marketing to help think through our Go-to-Market models and packaging/solutioning around these products.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 15 years of professional work experience.
  • 10 years of experience in a Product Management role.
  • Experience delivering consumer or enterprise products at scale and managing complex product solutions with multiple stakeholders, leading either product or engineering functions.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA degree.
  • Technical background in computer science.
  • Experience building gaming products on private or public cloud environments
  • Understanding of how technologies can shape institutions, innovate and deliver growth.
  • Passionate about using cloud and mobile technologies to generate strategic differentiation within customers across industries and geographies.
responsibilities:
• Develop cloud-based solutions and products for the Gaming industry that help Google bring the best of its Google Cloud products into the market.
  • Work closely with broader Google Cloud Product Management and Engineering teams to take the best of their existing services and help define and outline product gaps and build those product gaps that can drive customer adoption.
  • Deliver on the most effective set of product solutions and go-to-market strategy for gaming customers.
  • Build and foster relationships with internal Gaming stakeholders to ensure we are bringing the best of Google services to our gaming customers.
title: Product Manager, Gaming Cloud Solutions, Google Cloud Platform
